name: Just Call Dave
text: It's odd this facility accepts donations, but wanted to pick and choose when items to donate was free.  My suggestion don't donate here, but give those who need help without being greedy.

name: M Green
text:
I just moved into my new place and needed to furnish every room. I spent days and weeks looking for high-quality furniture at different stores but unfortunately the high-quality furniture came with a high quality price. I couldn’t believe how much it cost for a dining room table,  couch and other furniture items.

Then Someone recommended the  bargain Center,

I was Initially discouraged about all of the places and wasted time and I spent looking for unfounded  items. however I decided to give this place a visit.

I walked in the store and saw all of the high-quality furniture and was impressed with the  cost.  When I say high-quality  I am referring to durable top-of-the-line furniture that you would  see at the Elite stores.

I was able to furnish my living room, dining room, three bedrooms and I was able to rent a U-Haul truck at the same location to transfer my furniture to my new place.

Everyone in the store was so friendly and helpful. I will definitely recommend this place for furniture needs, clothing needs, most of all your items.

PS. I picked up some boots and already received five compliments.

name: Xandi Andersen
text: Best thrift store in Montgomery! I go in about once a week and I find great deals every time I go. Sometimes they'll surprise you with a discount at checkout or they'll throw a free gift in your bag during the holidays . The staff there are such kind-hearted people, too. They're always happy to be there and most are volunteers who just enjoy serving their community. They even keep shelves outside stocked with nonperishable items so folks in the neighborhood can take what they need even after the store closes.

name: Patricia Holliday June
text: I recommend them for great bargains, awesome customer service, and what they do for the community. You have to visit and show your support for our locally owned businesses that service our residents, and provide accessible location and great prices! Appreciate what they did for our community event! Appreciated the support of Mrs. Browder, and her son who now manages the thrift store.

name: Melissa Davis
text: I was looking for a kitchen dining table for my kitchen and I went to 3 different goodwills first but they were either in bad shape or not a set. I went to the bargain center and as soon as I walked in there was this gorgeous 3 piece set that was exactly what I was looking for and it was reasonably priced! I used to shop there a long time ago but I forgot about it. I can tell you that the next time I need a particular piece, this is the very first place that I will come to plus the staff is very friendly and helpful!

name: Derrick Watkins
text: This is my favorite thrift store in the Montgomery metro area. Mr. Browder and staff are the friendliest and most  accommodating people I have ever encountered. I have found many excellent deals here. God bless this store and staff!!!

name: S Cl
text: This store is so much more than a thrift store where you can find newer and used furniture.  It is an opportunity to witness Christianity in action and more importantly, become a part of it! So happy and thankful for Mr. Browder and crew!

name: Shakethia Kennebrew
text: I'm a thrift store connoisseur...this place has potential but not enough, I left empty handed. Not because I didn't find anything but the pricing is so high! The USED dresses in the front were 24.99 and 19.99!! 2pc suits 14.99! I'll just keep visiting my favs when I drive to Birmingham when I can get similar items in the 4.00- 10.00 range. Coats were 19.99 I've purchased similar elsewhere for $5-10 bucks! I didn't even see pricing on the dresses in the back of the store. You should consider pricing to sell.

name: Julia Fuller
text: I been shopping at the store when it first opening. They have some very nice things there for a really good price. That u would pay more some were ealse. Ones u shop there u always come again, People be there Sat. Morning at 9:00am. In line to shop so come on over in see for yourself you be glad u came.

name: Melinda Jackson
text: Great prices and they will work with you. Just ask! They are such a blessing.

name: Jeremiah Junk
text: Good people, cashier lady was very helpful and nice and the prices were good!

name: Myra Powell
text: I absolutely love this place. The staff is always helpful and friendly, and they really do have a great selection. I mean its a thrift store so if you're expecting the latest collections from ralph lauren then you're a fool. But they really do have some great finds in here and everything is reasonably priced. Just purchased a beautiful LG flat screen and matching lg dvd player from them. Definitely will be back

name: Curtis Browder
text: Wonderful Place to Shop for hidden treasures. May God Continue to Bless you all for everything you do for the community.

name: mzton2turntup
text: Very friendly customer service!!! Always got great deals and always willing to negotiate to please the customer. Thanks again👌🏽

name: ND Seibel
text: Friendly people and you never know what you'll find, including old fashioned kitchen ware, missing pieces of antique china, and who knows what else. My mom and aunt love this place and have to go every time they visit Montgomery.

name: myla harper
text: Today something amazing took place at the Bargain Center. A woman came in the store wanting to rent a Uhaul, crying and all upset because she was put out and had no place to go. Mr. Stephen Browder became her hero. He began to make phone calls while also calming the woman down . Before leaving the thrift store she had a place to stay, Faith Crusade Montgomery Rescue Mission women’s shelter, a storage to put her items in, a Uhaul Truck, and help to gather her items and ensure that she was safe. I witnessed the woman’s tears of sorrow transform into tears of joy as she thanked Mr. Browder, his team and Jesus. The staff is simply amazing demonstrating the love of God to those who are in need of real help. Yes I would recommend all come to the Bargain Center Thrift Store to shop and spread the word about Uhaul rentals.

name: Candi Galloway
text: Very nice people and very helpful. Will definitely go back.

name: theoddfan 0
text: I am not sure who the owner is but I hope she reads this.  This place is named the "Bargain Center" but what I do not understand is when I ask about an item's price, the black lady says its not negotiable.  I am confused especially after I saw her cut a deal with another customer.  Now with that being said, I will not return due to dishonesty in the treatment of customer.  Plus, I see some items are overpriced like this Chinese picture that has a 50 price tag and its collecting dust on the shelf.

name: Loraine Johnson
text:
My go to place every Saturday!
Cutie loves the Bargain Center.
Thanks to Stephen and LJ

resp.text:
Thank you for your continue support.
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Terri Thomas
text: GREAT place to find stuff at cheap prices! Plus everyone is warm & friendly!

resp.text: Thank you Ms T, We are striving to get better. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

text: Mostly junk. No real good items. Stuff is priced so high, people with money can’t afford it or would pay for it. Don’t waste your time here. Not worth the drive.

resp.text: We apologize for your experience, however, we are rectifying the situation. We hope you will come back to shop with us again soon. Thank you for your constructive criticism.

name: Mary Helen Dixon
text:
Handcrafts from around the world!
Books will help in my private life. Gorgeous art - especially from China. Great ideas for children's activities. I have used some in the classroom as well as at church. Call ahead for a tour....991-8100.

name: Matthew James
text:
This is Women's Missionary Union (WMU).  A Southern Baptist women's Missionary organization.   They do missionary work throughout the world. It is worth the drive to visit and tour.
There are many artifacts from their missionary ministry throughout the beautiful building.

text: Wonderful building. Lots of historical displays. Nice outside areas.

name: Bill Tiemann
text: Oak Mountain Ministries is a great asset to the Birmingham Alabama community. The mission serves the needy by supplying food, clothing and household items to those who are in need. Churches and individuals provide new and lightly used but serviceable items to supply the mission in addition to funds through mission offerings.

name: Ayla Thacker (Evas World)
text: This is a wonderful resource for anyone struggling. The entire staff is delightful, courteous, and helpful. And please, if you have money or time to spare, donate or volunteer. Couldn't work with better people!

name: Angelia Riley
text: Oak Mountain has wonder people! They have a heart of service helping people. They have made a difference in my life.

name: Glenda Strength

Solo by one of Paula Kornegay students in the music arts class in First Baptist Clanton. Barry Kornegay brought the message on the life-of Jesus during Holy Week. Then the death and burial and Resurrection of JESUS! Followed by the Lord's Supper! What what a blessing!! Please remember the reason for this week of Easter, is our Lord Jesus Christ Our Savior!!

name: George Key
text: Very friendly and helpful people they are a blessing in every aspect of the word

name: Damon Davis
text: This mission is one of the more impressive organizations in Birmingham. You don’t hear their name often because much of what they do is not publicized. Tracy Hipps and his team seem to have their hands in charitable acts throughout all of Birmingham. This place feeds people, clothes them, provides medical supplies, restore homes and the list goes on and on. I love their vision, faith, and resolve to help others in their community.

name: Ronny Perkins
text: Great place. Service to the community in a Christ centered program.

name: rhonda jo
text: Through Pulix I was able to volunteer services in helping children with school necessities. I found out that this project is apart of a well put together Ministry that  educates children in reading (preparing them for a successful life) and also help the parents as well! HEARTFELT! I'm waiting on the next opportunity to help. Beautiful.

name: LINDA Mcginnis
text: Wonderful people loving the Lord to help serve

name: Wanda
text: GDD Geraldine Taylor, and other members of Dist  #13 Order of Eastern Star, delivered items to the Misson for delivery to  the Bahamas.  WE WERE BLESSED TO BE A BLESSING!!!! Christian Service Mission is wonderful.❤

name: Janet
text: I just love going to Christian Services, the Staff is always Cheerful and want to help in any way. If Your looking for a Christian atmosphere to donate Your time and or to donate items or money then they are the ones. Don't take my word for it you will want to go back again and again.

name: Brandon Johnson
text: Great service project for our whole church to go work here a few hours on a number of different jobs for different ages and skills.

name: Roger Kirkland
text: This week was our first experience with this group of wonderful people......such a Blessing to meet each one ,and work along side other groups.......Thank you for all that you do for the Glory of God.......Roger Kirkland First Baptist Bells Tennessee .......Love you all

name: Jacobia Griffin
text: Atosphere wonderful , people are nice

name: Jennifer Malone
text: Because they help the less fortunate!

name: Ashley Echols
text:
My husband and I had the most amazing time at Caritas! We were welcomed with open arms as soon as we arrived and loved the private tour we were given. The community is faith-filled, vibrant and joyful!

We especially loved the hike to the Cross on the mountaintop. It truly is a hidden gem and we recommend it to everyone! On the hike up are the Stations of the Cross, which is very profound. We’re so thankful for our time on our own little pilgrimage in Alabama!

We learned a lot about Our Lady of Medjugorje and truly felt Her presence with us. God is great and we will definitely be back soon!

name: Alex Hartman
text: Really nice waterfall right behind their place

name: Cynthia Fite
text: ALWAYS!! A blessing to be with the people. You can not help but feel like family. They always welcome you. So friendly and nice. Always calm and peaceful. Truly beautiful place. Thank you for your hospitality, ALWAYS!!

name: Fran HB
text: Faith Capital in America.  God Bless US More, I hope to visit one day.  God Bless America Forever!!

name: Janet Stewart
text: Because of this unusual beautiful holy place, I was awarded the opportunity of a lifetime.  To meet the visionary Marija, and to be present at many apparitions of the Blessed Virgin Mary.  These circumstances are almost indescribable.  Would take a book to explain.  The people who live and work at Caritas are wonderful people...(not perfect people; like many expect them to be), but some of the best people I have ever met and known.  To have been a part of these Miraculous episodes is to have been Graced beyond anything I ever imagined!  Thank you for Terry's insight and never ending fortitude, and all the people who work there untiringly to promote the Greatest Gift the world has ever known since Jesus Christ, our Lord and Savior, became Man in order to save our lives!!  Sincerely with Love, Janet

name: Michael Hebert
text: Caritas is a dedicated Christian community, of a number of real growing families, living in a manner reminiscent of Early Christian Church Communities, written of in the Book of Acts.  While some reviewers may speak improperly,  regarding them, the majority of people familiar with Caritas and Terry (A Friend of Medjugorje), recognize Caritas as a special place, blessed with the presence of Our Lady, and a lifestyle, unhampered, by the modernism of today.  Many things, written in humility, by Friend of Medjugorje,  have become evident as truth, as time moves forward.  While no one, or group, can claim to be perfect, Caritas sets a wonderful example of how best to live the precepts of a Christian life.  While the narrow path they choose, isn't chosen by everyone, in this world, it exemplifies a profound dedication to Love, Hope, Charity, and Perseverance.  Anyone seeking to understand, what God's Blessings, can truly mean, if one dedicates their life to Christ, through Our Holy Mother, only needs to visit this Heavenly place, in Alabama. May God continue to Bless these wonderful people.

name: Alicia Myrick
text: I love this place is so peacefully... I wish I could've  there for ever..  !! Is speechless

name: Chris Bearden
text: The people there are very kind and welcoming! I visited on business and they invited me in for delicious gumbo. I'd love to visit again soon on my own time!

name: mark barnes
text:
Very holy and sacred grounds where Blessed Mother appeared to visionary Maria Luneti many times.
Good conservative Catholic lay Medjugorje missionaries!

name: Luke Schroer
text: This is a Religious Cult. It's literally on a national list of cults. I unfortunately was tied in with the community for a while and they are constantly seeking money. The writings are subtly written with militant undertones they are very dangerous and many good people get sucked into believing some very dangerous and downright incorrect beliefs. They homeschool the kids in the community and each year they have a theme, one year I was down there the theme was literally the South will rise again, I could give several examples of really bizarre things that go on there.

name: Bobby Clayton
text: Awesome place to visit

name: Andrew Barbary
text: Great place to pilgrimage. Heard much good about Caritas - believe it all since I've been there and met the people and Terry Colafrancesco the founder, a great inspired man.

name: Mike Capelle
text:
Caritas of Birmingham is a truly blessed place. My family visited there almost 4 years ago and we have been coming back ever since. Walking around their grounds you can tangibly feel the presence of Our Lady & Her spouse the Holy Spirit. Getting to see the witness of the community members over the past 4 years has deepened my faith, has led to a deeper conversion within my family, and has led to a personal indescribable love for Jesus, His Mother Mary, and His Church. The thing that really stood out to me was the love that the community members showed each other and showed my family. I have a fairly rambunctious group of kiddos and their energy only brought loving smiles. Smiles during the Rosary, during the Chaplet of Divine Mercy, and all of their interactions with them. They are a beautiful community focused on introducing the world to Our Lady of Medjugorje to bring as many souls to Jesus as they possibly can.

If you get a chance to visit, take the time to:  1) Pray the Rosary in the Field of Apparitions where Our Lady of Medjugorje has appeared prior to apparition time (rosary starts at 11:00am in the summer // 10:00am in the spring/fall). 2) Pray the Stations of the Cross on a hike to the Cross on top of Penitentiary Mountain. 3) Hike the mountain across the valley from the Cross to the Grotto La Pluie. 4) Pray the Chaplet of Divine Mercy at 3:00pm.

Lastly, satan hates this place because of the community's love of Our Lady & their work of bringing more people to Jesus through His Mother.  People's negative reactions to this beautiful community can only be explained through that perspective.

John 15:18-21: 18 “If the world hates you, know that it has hated me before it hated you.[a]  19 If you were of the world, the world would love its own; but because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.  20 Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant[b] is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.  21 But all this they will do to you on my account, because they do not know him who sent me".

Matthew 7:16-18: 16 "You will know them by their fruits. Are grapes gathered from thorns, or figs from thistles? 17 So, every sound tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears evil fruit.  18 A sound tree cannot bear evil fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit".

Through Mary to Jesus,
Mike

name: Larry Milner
text: Never visited baristas of Birmingham. Irate 0 Stars
